_header: Of this martyr make we mend
_description: A song for St. Stephen’s Day — three macaronic quatrains (abab) and burden (bb): ‘Eya martir stephane / Prey for vs we prey to þe’

CamTCC1230.First Lines:
Of þis marter make we mendequi triumphavit
                    hodieAnd to heuene blysse gan wendeDono celestis
                    gracie…
CamTCC1230.Last Lines: …Eya martir stephanepray for vs we pray to ye
CamTCC1230.Editions:
Fuller-Maitland,  John Alexander,  and  William Smyth Rockstro.  
             English Carols of the Fifteenth Century.
         London: Leadenhall Press; New York: Scribner’s, 1891: 23.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 63; 1977, 52.
